rows.parent_text_question:
It is hard to find time to have fun with your children. How many days in the past week did you do something fun together? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.feedback_better::0: Well done for spending time with your child, it makes all the difference!
rows.feedback_better::1: Well done for spending time to do something fun with your child! You are making great progress. Keep it up!
rows.feedback_better::2: Great that you are setting aside time with your child – it is THE foundation for a happy home!
rows.feedback_better::3: Amazing that you keep doing fun things with your child. You are the best parent they could wish for!
rows.feedback_better::4: So good that you and your child are having fun times together. Your hard work is paying off, you should be proud of yourself!
rows.feedback_worse::0: We know it is hard to find time in our busy lives. Well done for trying your best!
rows.feedback_worse::1: Give yourself credit for trying. A 5 minutes of fun activity with your child a day can make a BIG difference.
rows.feedback_worse::2: We understand that it can be difficult to find time to spend with your child. Well done for trying, you can do it!
rows.feedback_worse::3: Life can get so busy sometimes, I know! If you start spending time together doing one small activity, it will get easier over time!
rows.feedback_worse::4: Finding time to do something fun with your child can be hard, I understand! The great thing is that spending time together will make other things go easier – you will see!
rows.intro_text: It is hard to find time to have fun with your teenager.

intro_text.eng: It is hard to find time to have fun with your teenager.

slider_question.eng: How many days in the past week were you able to do something fun together?

rows.slider_question: How many days in the past week were you able to do something fun together?

rows.parent_text_question:
In our busy lives, it's hard to focus on the positive. How many days in the past week have you praised your child? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.feedback_better::0: Wonderful that you are praising your child! This helps them feel seen and loved – your encouragement means a lot.
rows.feedback_better::1: So good to hear you are telling your child when they are doing something well. With time, you will see them do that behaviour more and more. You are doing a great job!
rows.feedback_better::2: Well done for praising your child. Praise will help your child feel good about themselves, and they will show even more positive behaviour!
rows.feedback_better::3: Great work! By praising your child, yourself and your other family members, you are making your house a happy home!
rows.feedback_better::4: It is great that you are praising your child for things they do well. As you appreciate them, they will also start appreciating you and the others in your family more – you set the best example!
rows.feedback_worse::0: We all sometimes feel like our children are causing more negativity than positivity. Try to see through negative attitudes and praise any positive behaviour you notice. With time, you will see the change!
rows.feedback_worse::1: Sorry that it has been harder for you to praise your child. Try to find something positive, even if it is small. Over time, they will appreciate that you notice when they do something well.
rows.feedback_worse::2: I understand it can be hard to praise your child sometimes. Remember, your praise makes a big difference, even if you don’t see it right away!
rows.feedback_worse::3: With everything that is going on, it is not always easy to focus on the positive. Try to find 10 minutes to pay attention to what your child is doing – perhaps you can praise them for helping with a chore or for doing their homework? It helps a lot!
rows.feedback_worse::4: Sometime our children don’t seem to do or say many things that deserve praise. Start praising the small things, you will see your child showing more positive behaviour over time!
rows.intro_text: In our busy lives it’s hard to focus on the positive.

intro_text.eng: In our busy lives it’s hard to focus on the positive.

slider_question.eng: How many days in the past week have you praised your teen?

rows.slider_question: How many days in the past week have you praised your teen?

rows.parent_text_question:
This is a very stressful time for families. How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.feedback_better::0: Did you know that you are less stressed than you were last week? Amazing!
rows.feedback_better::1: It’s wonderful to hear you are feeling less stress than last week. Keep up the good work!
rows.feedback_better::2: Amazing that you are feeling less stressed! Remember to keep taking a deep breath every time something makes you feel anxious – you are doing a great job!
rows.feedback_better::3: It is great you are feeling less stressed. We all have our ups and downs – remember the good times whenever things get challenging!
rows.feedback_better::4: Well done for managing your stress! Life can get overwhelming sometimes, but remember you can always take a pause – you are doing amazing.
rows.feedback_worse::0: We understand that this is a stressful time. Remember that you are not alone. We are here to help!
rows.feedback_worse::1: Life can be overwhelming sometimes. Well done for trying your best, you are valued and appreciated!
rows.feedback_worse::2: We all feel stressed sometimes, it’s normal. Remember to be kind to yourself and take a minute for yourself when you need it, you are doing a great job!
rows.feedback_worse::3: It can be stressful to get through the day sometimes. At the end of each day, remember to praise yourself for doing your best!
rows.feedback_worse::4: It is okay to feel overwhelmed from time to time, we all do! Take a deep breath and remember that we are here to help.
rows.intro_text: This is a very stressful time for families.

intro_text.eng: This is a very stressful time for families.

slider_question.eng: How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver?

rows.slider_question: How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver?

rows.parent_text_question:
Sometimes our children make us really upset. How many days in the past week did you shout, scream, or yell at your children? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.feedback_better::0: Well done! Brain science shows if you control your anger when your child misbehaves, you increase your child's brain development. Be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
rows.feedback_better::1: Great work! When we respond calmly, our teens are more likely to do the same.
rows.feedback_better::2: Well done for keeping calm in difficult situations – that is definitely not easy to do! You are setting a great example for your child.
rows.feedback_better::3: It is great that you can address your child more and more calmly when they upset you. Working through challenges together will help your child so much in life – you are doing amazing!
rows.feedback_better::4: So good that you speak to your child calmly, even when they drive you crazy. You should be proud of yourself! Remember to keep taking deep breaths every time you feel they are testing your patience.
rows.feedback_better::5: Wonderful to hear that you are managing to stay calm in difficult situations. You should be proud of yourself – keep up the great work!
rows.feedback_worse::0: It can be difficult to control our anger, especially when they make us really angry. Take a deep breath, and be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
rows.feedback_worse::1: Sorry that you are having a difficult time with your child. It happens to all of us. Remember, we can choose to behave differently next time.
rows.feedback_worse::2: We all get overwhelmed sometimes. Next time when you feel angry, try taking a deep breath before responding. This helps a lot!
rows.feedback_worse::3: When we get angry, it can be hard to stay calm. Try to recognise your emotions and those of your child, and talk about them later - this helps everyone to understand each other better next time. You can do it!
rows.feedback_worse::4: Being a parent is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!
rows.feedback_worse::5: Our children can really drive us crazy sometimes. By responding calmly, they will learn to do the same when something upsets them at home or outside. Your patience will pay off, you will see!
rows.intro_text: Sometimes our children make us really upset.

intro_text.eng: Sometimes our children make us really upset.

slider_question.eng: How many days in the past week did you shout, scream or yell at your teen?

rows.slider_question: How many days in the past week did you shout, scream or yell at your teen?

rows.parent_text_question:
Money is one of the biggest stresses for families now. How many days in the past week have you felt very worried or anxious about money? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.intro_text: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families.

intro_text.eng: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families.

rows.parent_text_question:
How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.slider_question: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food?

slider_question.eng: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food?

rows.parent_text_question:
It is so stressful when children misbehave. How many days in the past week did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
rows.feedback_better::0: It is wonderful that you are responding in a calm way when your child does something upsetting. They can learn so much from you!
rows.feedback_better::1: Well done! Learning new ways of responding to your children when they misbehave will make a BIG difference in the way they learn how to resolve conflicts as they get older.
rows.feedback_better::2: Amazing! You are setting such a great example for your children on how to respond calmly in difficult situations – keep up the good work!
rows.feedback_better::3: Great to see you are managing to respond calmly to your child, that’s a big accomplishment! Celebrate this win, you are a star.
rows.feedback_better::4: Well done for managing your emotions! When things get tough, you can always take a pause and address the problem later on when everyone is calm. You are doing a great job.
rows.feedback_better::5: So good! Every time you choose to be calm and clear, you are showing your child how much you care about them. They will feel heard and loved, and will be more likely to listen to you!
rows.feedback_worse::0: It sounds like you are having a difficult time with your child. This can be really hard so be patient with yourself. Try to take a pause (even one deep breath!) next time and respond differently. You can do it!
rows.feedback_worse::1: It can be so difficult to keep calm when things get out of hand. Try again next time – each day is a new opportunity!
rows.feedback_worse::2: Our children sometimes drive us crazy. Remember, you can always take a pause and address the problem later on when everyone is calm. You can do it!
rows.feedback_worse::3: Sometimes everything gets too much! Remember to recognise when you feel that way and take a few deep breaths before responding. Your child will learn from your good example!
rows.feedback_worse::4: Sorry that things are not always easy with your child. When they upset you, try to remain calm, That way, you can keep clear boundaries and solve problems together. You can do it!
rows.feedback_worse::5: We all struggle to stay calm sometimes. Take a deep breath and remember that mistakes are human. Talking to your child will help more in the end – you are an awesome parent!
rows.intro_text: It is so stressful when children misbehave.

intro_text.eng: It is so stressful when children misbehave.

slider_question.eng: How many days in the past week did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt?

rows.slider_question: How many days in the past week did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt?

rows.parent_text_question: Bonus question: We all want to keep our children safe. In the past month, have you talked with your child about keeping safe from sexual violence online or offline? This could be when they are going out with friends, or talking about the websites they use.
